qd5vTbjc.question:
Refer to figure. 
 Have a look at the attached figure NET LEVEL-OFF ALTITUDE. Why are the temperature lines broken at 17 000 ft?

options.text: The air condition is turned off below 17 000 ft.
The air condition it turned off above 17 000 ft.
Fuel dumping can be started at 17 000 ft and above.
Usually there is an inversion at 17 000 ft.

e42yihNP.question: Refer to figure 032-70. With regard to the information given below, and assuming taxi distance is negligible, what would be the minimum turn-around time according to brake cooling schedule? - Landing mass: 50 000 kg - Runway: 24 - Wind: 060° / 4 kt - V~REF~: 128 kt - Airport elevation: 1 000 ft - QNH **1013** hPa - OAT: +25 °C (For wind correction, use -50 % of headwind / +150 % for tailwind)

options.text: 17 minutes, using reverse #2 detent with autobrake #1 or #2
72 minutes, using reverse #2 detent with autobrake #1 or #2
1-2 minutes, using NO reverse with autobrake #1 or #2
17 minutes, using NO reverse with autobrake #1 or #2

LOoiH0w1.question:

7GIHyNzB.question:

 For a twin engined turbojet in the cruise at M0.78, determine the hourly fuel flow at FL340 and a mass of 55000 kg.

YroJRv04.question:
Refer to the annex or CAP 698 Figure 4.31. An MRJT aeroplane has a generator failure during the take-off roll and the Captain decides to reject the take-off and taxi off the runway to hold on a taxiway. The generator is reset after 10 minutes and found to be functioning again and so the flight can resume. Given the following information, how long in total should the Captain wait before a further take-off, assuming any taxi distance is negligible?
  • Take-off mass: 57500 kg
  • Speed when fault occurred: 90 kt
  • Speed when rejection commenced: 100 kt
  • Retardation: Maximum braking and reverse thrust
  • Wind: Light and variable
  • Elevation: 1400 ft
  • QNH: 1013.25 hPa
  • OAT: -10°C

options.text: It is recommended to wait for approximately 35 minutes having used maximum braking and reverse thrust.
It is recommended to wait for approximately 50 minutes if some credit is given for using reverse thrust.
Only ground cooling is recommended, which means that a new take-off may be commenced now that the fault has been rectified
It is recommended to wait for approximately 40 minutes after using maximum manual braking.

9cvXjBAa.question: With regard to the drift down performance of the twin jet aeroplane, what is meant by "equivalent gross weight at engine failure"?

options.text: The equivalent gross weight at engine failure is the actual gross weight corrected for OAT higher than ISA +10° C.
The increment represents fuel used before engine failure.
This gross weight accounts for the lower Mach number at higher temperatures.
The increment accounts for the higher fuel flow at higher temperatures.

There is a built-in safety measure.
There is no effect of the wind on the climb angle relative to the ground.
The effect of the wind must be taken from another chart.

At higher temperatures the VMBE determines the climb limit mass

CO2dv4Lu.question:
Consider the methods listed below for improving the Field-Length Limited Take-Off Mass (FLL TOM) of an MRJT aeroplane. Which of the methods does the pilot have direct influence over?

  2. Decide NOT to use engine anti-ice to increase the FLL TOM by 450kg.
  3. Choose the runway with the most favourable wind component to increase the FLL TOM by the credit for any wind improvements.
  4. Perform a packs-off take-off to increase the FLL TOM by 550 kg.

options.text: 1 and 4, to improve the FLLTOM by 1150 kg
1, 2, and 4, to improve the FLLTOM by 1600 kg
3 and 4, to improve the FLLTOM by 550 kg plus the credit for any wind improvement
2 and 3, to improve the FLLTOM by 450 kg plus the credit for any wind improvement

K9iFI9Rp.question:

An MRJT aeroplane is landing on runway 25 at an airport which has a long, dry runway with no restrictions. It is chosen because of its negligible taxi distance post landing. The planned turnaround time is 25 minutes. Given the following information, is this turnaround time achievable?

options.text: Yes, provided reverse #2 detent is used with autobrake #1 or #2.

Yes, provided reverse #2 detent is used with any autobrake setting.
No, reverse thrust cannot be used for credit during landing resulting in a minimum cooling time of approximately 60 minutes for the lowest autobrake settings #1 and #2.

RA4a9Beg.question: Regarding the obstacle limited take off mass, which of the following is true?

Contamination on the runway will increase the maximum mass because of the reduced resistance against the wheels.
Contamination on the runway will decrease the maximum mass because of the increased resistance against the wheels.
Higher temperatures will increase the maximum mass because of the upward vertical airflow.

All the curves start at the same point, which is situated outside the chart.

It is recommended to wait for approximately 35 minutes having used maximum braking and reverse thrust.
